data.title: Alison and Dermot unimpressed as Deborah Meaden swears twice on This Morning
data.meta_description: This Morning hosts Alison Hammond and Dermot O'Leary were forced to apologise during Wednesday's show as Dragons' Den star Deborah Meaden turned the air blue
data.text:
Alison Hammond and Dermot O'Leary were forced to apologise to This Morning viewers on Wednesday after Deborah Meaden swore twice.

The 62-year-old Dragons' Den star turned the air blue as she spoke to the duo live from her home in Somerset.

Referring to the popular BBC programme, Alison asked Deborah: "How important is it for these entrepreneurs to be nice and personable?"

"Erm, it's not a question of liking," Deborah replied matter of factly. "I have to trust people.

"I don't want to be working in a business where I'm constantly looking over my shoulder or thinking, 'Do I know the truth? Are they actually presenting it as it is?'

"So I've got to be able to trust people. I don't know if I can say 'bullsh*t' but I'm going to! But I don't like bullsh*t!" she blurted out as Alison quickly responded.

"Apologies about that, for that word," Alison said with a serious look on her face as Dermot rolled his eyes.

"I shouldn't have said that, sorry," Deborah quickly replied as Alison said: "Don't worry, don't worry."

At the end of the interview, Alison joked: "You can go and wash your mouth out now!" as a mortified Deborah apologised again.

Viewers tuning in at home thought it was hilarious and took to Twitter to comment.

"I turn my back for five minutes and Deborah Meaden says bullsh*t live on #ThisMorning!" one person joked.

Another tweeted: "Deborah said bullsh*t. Funniest moment of 2022 on #ThisMorning."

Someone else tweeted: "Deborah Meaden saying 'Bullsh*t' on live television...I salute her. Fabulous woman Xxxxx #ThisMorning."

This Morning airs weekdays at 10am on ITV and ITV Hub.
